caseTitle: Abid Jan v. Ministry of Defence thr. its Secretary, Islamabad and others
tagline: When the writ petition was directed to be transmitted to the Federal Service Tribunal by the High Court, the petitioner was not required to file fresh memo of appeal. The doctrine of ex debito justitiae refers to the remedies to which a person is entitled to as of right, as opposed to a remedy which is discretionary. An act of the Court shall prejudice no one. The Court or Tribunal should be conscious and cognizant that nobody should become a victim of injustice as a consequence of their mistake.
